benchmark_details.name: Dataset of Solution-based Inorganic Materials Synthesis Recipes
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents the first large-scale dataset of 35,675 solution-based synthesis 'recipes' extracted from the scientific literature, containing essential synthesis information including the precursors, target materials, their quantities, and the synthesis actions and corresponding attributes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive dataset of solution-based inorganic materials synthesis recipes to enhance data-driven approaches in materials synthesis.

data.source: Scientific literature, specifically articles downloaded from major publishers after the year 2000.
data.annotation: Manual and automatic extraction techniques using advanced NLP and ML models.

methods: NLP techniques for material entity recognition
Machine learning for synthesis action extraction
methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on the accuracy of extraction against a manually curated validation set.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance of the data extraction methods.
methodology.baseline_results: F1 scores for key fields exceed 90%
methodology.validation: Validation through manual inspection of 100 entries.
